descriptionNullable:
# **Case Study: HOW CAN A WELLNESS TECHNOLOGY COMPANY PLAY IT SMART?**


## **Welcome to the Bellabeat data analysis case study**

In this case study, I have performed many real-world tasks of a junior data analyst. I was working for Bellabeat, a high-tech manufacturer of health-focused products for women, and meet different characters and team members.

I have followed the steps of the data analysis process: ask, prepare, process, analyse, share, and act. 





## Scenario 
As a junior data analyst working on the marketing analyst team at Bellabeat, a high-tech manufacturer of health-focused products for women. Bellabeat is a successful small company, but they have the potential to become a larger player in the global smart device market.
 Urška Sršen, cofounder and Chief Creative Officer of Bellabeat, believes that analysing smart device fitness data could help unlock new growth oppo unities for the company. 
I have been asked to focus on one of Bellabeat’s products and analyse smart device data to gain insight into how consumers are using their smart devices.
 The insights you discover will then help guide marketing strategy for the company. I am presenting my analysis to the Bellabeat executive team along with your high-level recommendations for Bellabeat’s marketing strategy.

## Characters/Stakeholders
•	Urška Sršen: Cofounder and Chief Creative Officer of Bellabeat.
•	Sando Mur: Cofounder and a key member of the executive team.
•	The marketing analytics team consists of data analysts who analyze data to help guide Bellabeat's marketing strategy.		

## Products: 
Leaf: A wellness tracker that can be worn in different styles.
Time: A wellness watch that tracks health metrics.
Spring: A smart water bottle that tracks hydration levels.
Bellabeat app and membership: Provides health data and personalized guidance.




## Ask
Find the trends among smart devices, how people are using the device and find potential opportunities for growth. What is that new thing that people want to monitor. 
1.	Identify prevailing trends in the usage of smart devices.
2.	Explore how these trends could be relevant to Bellabeat's customer base.
3.	Discuss how these trends could potentially increase Bellabeat's marketing strategies.
Some questions I want to include based on SMART technique:
•	Who’s responsible for it? 
•	What steps need to be taken to achieve it? 
•	Revenue data, turnover data, performance data for each product.
•	How much time do we need to achieve goals?




## PREPARE

The Fit-Bit Fitness Tracker Data, a publicly available dataset on Kaggle provided by Mobius, includes detailed fitness tracking information from thirty consenting Fitbit users. This dataset encompasses data at the minute level covering physical activities, steps, heart rate, and sleep patterns. 


## PROCESS

This analysis focuses on 
•	Activity data
•	sleep data
•	heart rate data
•	Weight data
•	Calories data
The tools that I have used during the process 
1.	Spreadsheet for activity data cleaning, and merging files for hourly activity data
2.	R programming for Daily activity data, sleep data, calories data
3.	R script for Visualization
4.	Tableau for changing data type of heartrate data, merging files, visualization of weight data.
5.	Kaggle for importing data.

## R programming Code for sleep data:

--- title: "Sleep_data" 
author: "Rohan" 
date: "2024-05-14" 
output: pdf_document: default html_document: default ---
installing packages
{r} install.packages('tidyverse') 
library(tidyverse) 
library(readr)
##setting directories
{r} setwd("/cloud/project/mturkfitbit_export_4.12.16-5.12.16/Fitabase Data 4.12.16-5.12.16")
##creating dataframe
{r} sleep_day <- read.csv("sleepDay_merged.csv")
##summary
{r} head(sleep_day) 
colnames(sleep_day) 
n_distinct(sleep_day$Id)
nrow(sleep_day)
##table with few elements
{r} sleep_day %>% 
select(TotalSleepRecords,
 TotalMinutesAsleep,
 TotalTimeInBed) %>% 
summary()
##visualization
{r} ggplot(data=sleep_day, aes(x=TotalMinutesAsleep, y=TotalTimeInBed)) + geom_point(color="purple") + labs(title ="Sleep_efficiency")



## Analyse
•	People use Product more in cooler months or less sunny weather.
•	More active during the day time.
•	Sedentary minutes are more but not asleep tends to decrease in sleep efficiency.
•	Average heartrate in the people who are more active is more balanced over the data considered for two months 
•	People with maintained weight have Good BMI tends to less problems and become more fit 
•	People have better average heartrate value who are wearing longer and check frequently.
•	People are more actives on weekends


## Solutions and Conclusions 

•	Increase sales and marketing campaigns during colder months and new year times when people set resolution goals, approach Gyms, fitness community for surveys.
•	Start production line for Male audience.
•	Work more on sales so that more users can use the devices
•	Reach audience who engages with more activity and influence others.
•	Survey people about the liking and disliking of the product and what they like to include in the smart device
•	Some people are not wearing it for longer so, maybe increase quality of straps, if that’s the reason.
•	More notification inclusions like sleep quality, exercises list to normalise heartrate, SOS calls for emergency.

## Recommendations:

Three best Approach I would recommend for business to take:
**SOS calls**: People should be very aware of safety and reaching hospitals and doctors on time during emergency.
**Survey and campaigns**: Work on sales and marketing to reach more audience and include male audience too.
**Activity and Sleep Quality**: People nowadays are very busy and also having less sleep and more sedentary lifestyle. 

So, include some notifications reminder to do some activity, exercise and sleep time, data about last day sleep, what they can do to increase sleep quality
Include tips and natural techniques for them.
title: Case Study from Coursera Google
subtitle: Bellabeat_Fitness_Tracking_Data
